summary:
I have always been intrigued by the way we behave. Take for example the role of habits. Because of our habits, we are able to do several complex behaviors simultaneously: driving a car, participating in traffic while talking to a friend. If something happens in traffic, you are still able to drive the car and participate in traffic, but you are unable to continue your talk. If you think about this, it is fascinating!

Since my PhD in 2003 on the role of habits at Utrecht University, I work as a Senior Researcher at Altrecht Eating Disorders Rintveld. In my research I focus on the interplay between emotional and cognitive functioning of people with eating disorders. I collaborate with excellent scientists from different fields within my research group URGE as with many interns and scientists from other (international) universities and institutes. 
Part of my work as a scientist at a highly specialized (op TOPGGz) center for eating disorders, is to oversee and coordinate all scientific studies done at Rintveld. As I greatly value translational research and academic thinking, I aim to bridge scientific findings and clinical practice. I am therefore part of different teams and committees within Rintveld as well as within Altrecht, such as the Committee Scientific Research and the Scientific Advisory Board of Altrecht mental health institute. In March 2019 I had the pleasure to join the Board of Directors of the Academy of Eating Disorders in which I currently fulfill the role of the secretary. 

Since 2016 I also hold a teaching position at the department of Clinical Psychology of Utrecht  University. I enjoy individual supervision of bachelor and master students as well as teaching a variety of workgroups and giving lectures to a larger audience. I am also very pleased to be part again of such an excellent department and collaborate with great researchers and teachers.

Another major reason for waking up cheerfully each morning is my family. I find it so special to watch my two children learn new stuff each day and become more and more independent . And when possible, I love to smash a ball on the tennis court, cook a great meal or have drinks with my friends.

profile_positions.description:
My main tasks
•	Coordinating scientific and innovative projects and managing the research team at Rintveld
•	Strengthening and guarding the connection between (scientific) theory and practice
•	Collaborating with others in the ED field and within Altrecht GGZ
•	Conducting psychological studies 
The focus of my research is on the emotional and cognitive functioning of people with eating disorders and I like to take a transdiagnostic perspective by examining similarities and differences between patient groups. In one such project I examine the role of depressive symptoms in impaired decision making in people with unipolar and bipolar depression, somatic symptom disorder and anorexia nervosa, a study I conducted across several Altrecht departments in collaboration with several colleagues.
 
Translating scientific findings to clinical practice is important and I often collaborate with (inter)national colleagues. I have a longstanding collaboration with Rivierduinen Eating Disorders Ursula. For example, we got a ZONMW grant together with Trimbos Institute to examine the cost-effectiveness of our adult treatment program for adults with anorexia nervosa. I am also involved in a large ERA-NET (EU) funded project, in which we examine the gut microbiome of people with anorexia nervosa in relation to clinical and cognitive characteristics, the MiGBAN study. 

Other aspects of my work have to do with teaching at the bachelor and master level, supervision of PhD students and Clinical Psychologists in training, and advisor of other researchers at Rintveld and at Altrecht level (Committee Scientific Research and the Scientific Advisory Committee). Since March 2019, I am the secretary for the Academy of Eating Disorders. Finally, I am ad hoc reviewer for several international peer-reviewed journals.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description: Developing line of psychological research at Rintveld. Conducting scientific studies, presenting results at local, national and international meeting and writing international publications. Writing grant proposals. Organization of weekly Rintveld research meetings. Supervision of interns (research process and thesis) and research assistant. Reviewing scientific proposals of Altrecht researchers and attendance of monthly meetings as part of the Committee Scientific Research of Altrecht. Attendance of national and international conferences and other meetings. Ad hoc reviewer for several international peer-reviewed journals.
profile_positions.title: PostDoc Researcher

profile_positions.description:
The role of the Secretary is to oversee the membership acceptance process, the election process, the annual meeting notification process, the maintenance of minutes, the filing of reports to federal and state authorities, maintenance of membership records and other duties, as outlined in the policies and
procedures of the AED.
profile_positions.title: Secretary

profile_positions.description:
I am the board liaison for three different committees:
- Awards and Scientific Review Committee
- Fellows Committee
- Ethics Committee
The AED greatly values diversity, equity and inclusion. To facilitate this I am searching for ways to facilitate more clinicians outside of the US to attend the annual AED meetings (i.e. ICED) because I think it is important that they learn about the latest developments in the field of eating disorders, but also to enhance the interaction between researchers and clinicians. If you have any thoughts of this or are interested to contribute, please contact me!
profile_positions.title: Director for Standards of Excellence

profile_positions.description: I hold a teaching position at the department of Clincial Psychology one day a week. As part of this position, I supervise students in their Master thesis and clinical internships and I am co-coordinator of the master course Academic Professional). In addition, I give lectures, I am a working group teacher and every year I am also involved in a different course or study trajectory.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

company.name: Clinical and Health Psychology, Utrecht University

profile_positions.description: Supervision of bachelor projects and master theses. Teaching several courses (e.g. Research practice, Methods and statistics, Psychopathology) of the bachelor and master programs clinical and health psychology. Liaison between research groups of Clinical and Health Psychology and Rintveld. Organization of the Psychology and Health Research Institute workshop “Implicit measures in health behavior”, October 2008
profile_positions.title: Teaching assistant

profile_positions.description: PhD in Social Psychology. The aim of my project was to examine cognitive processes underlying habitual behavior and more specifically how the mind deals with alternative behaviors. How are habits formed to the extent that we do no longer have to consciously think about performing the behavior (as we no longer have to choose between different behaviors)? And when we decide to chance our habits, why is this so difficult? What kind of cognitive processes are involved?
profile_positions.title: PhD in Social Psychology
